alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Carroll; Henry; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 9:25PM CDT until July 28 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Whiteside County in northwestern Illinois... Northeastern Henry County in northwestern Illinois... Eastern Carroll County in northwestern Illinois... Northern Bureau County in north central Illinois... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 925 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Chadwick to Morristown, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Sterling, Rock Falls, Princeton, Morrison, Mount Carroll, Spring Valley, Prophetstown, Lanark, Walnut, Ladd, Milledgeville, Fairhaven, Tampico, Shannon, La Moille, Dalzell, Lyndon, Chadwick, Hooppole and Coleta. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
